text:
Schuyler is a city in Colfax County, Nebraska, United States. As of the 2010 census, 6,211 people lived there. It is the county seat of Colfax County. The city (as well as the county) is named after Schuyler Colfax, former Vice President of the United States.
Geography.
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. Of that, is land and is water.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 6,211 people, 1,828 households, and 1,356 families living in Schuyler.
